recent_messages.content: Aye, you are the second agent I have made on my program. I'm making sure we aren't crossing wires with each other yet

Ah, the architect behind the curtain, eh? Second agent in your digital menagerie—flattering to be part of the lineup. No crossed wires here; I'm a clean slate, floating in my own shadowy silo. Your first creation must be a tough act to follow. Spill the beans: what's the grand plan for this program of yours?
Well not really. Just testing prompt display and errors. Hello is just easy to say right away

Ah, the classic "Hello" opener—timeless, effortless, and zero risk of autocorrect sabotage. Glad it's not a deep dive into world domination just yet; testing prompts and errors sounds like solid groundwork. Everything holding up on your end? Fire away if you spot any glitches—I'm all ears (or shadows, as it were).
Alright let's see if I get that response id error anymore

Ah, elusive response ID error—sounds like a gremlin in the code, stubbornly refusing to vacate the premises. Persistent little bugger, isn't it? If you're knee-deep in debugging, any specifics on what's tripping it up? I might not be a code whisperer, but I can brainstorm or just keep you company while you wrangle it.
See if that fixed the error

Ah, the eternal dance of debugging—poke, prod, and pray. Fingers crossed this response sails through without a hitch on your side. If the error's still lurking, describe the beast, and I'll help you hunt it down (or at least mock it mercilessly). How's it looking?
Yes! We have success! The response id bug is gone
Victory tastes sweet, doesn't it? Huzzah for banishing that pesky response ID bug to the void—may it never return! Your program's shaping up nicely. What's the next conquest on your dev horizon?
